client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Client handles communicating with the server and processes which involves user interaction to the application. Client's connection to server is in the form of a thread through clientHandler. Client then handles posting votes, checking logins, and fetching groups which are needed for the GUI to show information about the queue and scores.
    Version:
    0.
    Author:
    group 4
    See Also:
    Gui, User

    • Method Detail

      • recieveAndSend

        public void recieveAndSend()
        Handles the communications with the server. First it sets a socket for which the client will connect and created object input and output streams. recieveAndSend then calls on the method checkForLogin to identify which user is communicating with the server. Following this, recieveAndSend ask the server about the group through askForGroup. postVote is then called to cast in votes that occurred and then askForGroup is called again to fetch a new Group with the votes implemented.
